correction_response:
This tweet is partially accurate but lacks context. It's true that Elon Musk, who recently joined Twitter's board of directors, had a Twitter spat with a U.S. Senator and has legally paid $0 in federal income taxes in certain years, as have other billionaires. This is due to U.S. tax laws that allow the ultra-rich to avoid income tax on wealth derived from assets until they are sold. However, it's also important to note that Musk's tax bill for 2021 could exceed $10 billion due to exercising stock options, and he has claimed to be contributing more than any other U.S. citizen this year.
